title: Analyst: Under-screen Face ID unlikely to launch until iPhone 16 at the earliest
content:
A report by The Elec from early today claims Apple will introduce an under-display Face ID sensor on the iPhone 15 Pro in 2023. DSCC analyst Ross Young, who has a great record of Apple leaks over the past months, contradicts the report and says the technology could land on iPhone 16 at the earliest.

moreâ€¦

The post Analyst: Under-screen Face ID unlikely to launch until iPhone 16 at the earliest appeared first on 9to5Mac.
description: DSCC analyst Ross Young believes under-screen Face ID will only launch with iPhone 16 at the earliest, and not with the iPhone 15 series.
